SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To summarize the peri-operative experience from 53 patients with traumatic head injuries with GCS score 3-5
METHODS: Fifty-three most severely head-injured patients with GCS score 3-5 were admitted to our department and treated operatively from Oct
1998 and the data were analyzed retrospectively
RESULTS: Thirty-seven cases (69.8%) survived, among them 28 (52.8%) had a good recovery or moderate disability, and 9 (17%) had severe deficits

CONCLUSIONS: The prognosis of most severely head-injured patients could be improved by peri-operative treatment including premedical care, early evacuation of intracranial hematoma with large decompressive craniectomies, intracranial hypertension monitoring, moderate hypothermia therapy, effective prevention and treatment of cerebral vasospasm and complications
